alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:11AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches west of US-395, little accumulation east of US-395, 4 to 8 inches between 8000 and 9000 feet, with 12 to 18 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting up to 40 to 50 mph in lower communities and over 100 mph along the Sierra crest. Wind gusts up to 60 mph in wind prone areas along US-395. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Roads may become slick and blowing snow may cause lower visibility while driving. Very strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
